title: Small Wishes
about:
An ambitious young woman trapped in an archaic village decides to shed the limitations of her coveted long hair for a chance at a life on her own terms.


“Small Wishes” is VFP’s second original production, co-directed by Santhosh Jay and Sabareesh Subramaniam, the 2021 recipients of the Iyackuddy Rabindran Short Film Fund. The Tamil-language short celebrates women’s empowerment and the importance of education for women, using a simple yet powerful story to inspire change. It has gone on to screen at prominent international film festivals, furthering VFP’s mission to champion impactful South Asian storytelling.
producers: Dilani Rabindran, Viewfinder Film Productions Inc
coproducers: Prithivi Adithya, Santhosh Jay, Sabareesh Subramaniam

title: Little Wings
about: Little Wings” is VFP’s third original production, directed by Naveen Mu. The Tamil-language short follows an elderly woman trapped in a bitter marriage who is pushed to the brink when her paralyzed husband sets out to consume her pet rooster. The film won multiple Best Film awards on the festival circuit, earned five Critics Choice Award nominations, and was the only Tamil short selected for the Indian Panorama at the 53rd International Film Festival of India. Its crowning achievement is winning the 71st Indian National Film Award for Best Cinematography (Non-Feature) — a landmark honour that firmly established VFP’s reputation in international independent cinema.
productionCompany: Viewfinder Film Productions Inc., Comrade Talkies
cast: Manimegalai (Panjavarnam), Nitharsana C. Kalidoss (Kaali), Madurai Ramji, Chinna Karupu

title: Theetu (Untouchability)
about:
One does not forget their caste, even when buying carrots.


In 2020, Viewfinder Film Productions (VFP) selected filmmaker Haresh Narayanan as the first recipient of the Iyackuddy Rabindran Short Film Fund, created in honour of VFP founder Dilani's late father, a lifelong supporter of her work and love for cinema.

This collaboration resulted in "Theetu", VFP's first original production — a bold Tamil-language short exploring pressing social themes. The film premiered at prestigious festivals such as the UK Asian Film Festival, New York Indian Film Festival, and South Asian Film Festival of America, earning finalist recognition at the Swedish International Film Festival.

Theetu set the foundation for VFP's growth into producing globally celebrated South Asian stories.
dialogue: A mix of witty and dramatic lines that enhance the storytelling.
